#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `some hedibX == 3 into 1`
* `-9 into 997`
* `-8 into 998`
* `otherwise into 0`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1, h_joint_disorders_age = heagf`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `-9 into 997`
* `-8 into 998`
* `otherwise, h_joint_disorders_age = 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
ELSA_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=ELSA_w1$id)
ELSA_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders <- rep(0,length(ELSA_w1$id))
ELSA_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders[which((ELSA_w1$hedib01==3 | ELSA_w1$hedib02==3 | ELSA_w1$hedib03==3 | ELSA_w1$hedib04==3 | ELSA_w1$hedib05==3 | ELSA_w1$hedib06==3 | ELSA_w1$hedib07==3 | ELSA_w1$hedib08==3 | ELSA_w1$hedib09==3 | ELSA_w1$hedib10==3))] <- 1
ELSA_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders[which(ELSA_w1$hedib01==-9)] <- 997
ELSA_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders[which(ELSA_w1$hedib01==-8)] <- 998

# Continuous variable harmonization
ELSA_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(ELSA_w1$id))
ELSA_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders_age[which(ELSA_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders==0)] <- 996
ELSA_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders_age[which(ELSA_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders==1)] <- car::recode(ELSA_w1$heagf[which(ELSA_ds_w1$h_joint_disorders==1)],"-1=996;-8=998;-9=997")

# Global table
ELSA_ds <- ELSA_ds_w1

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `h_joint_disorders w1 == 1 or some hedibX == 3 into 1`
* `h_joint_disorders w1 != 1 and hedib01 == -9 into 997`
* `h_joint_disorders w1 != 1 and hedib01 == -8 into 998`
* `otherwise into 0`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1, h_joint_disorders_age = HeAgf`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `-9 into 997`
* `-8 into 998`
* `otherwise, h_joint_disorders_age = 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w2}

ELSA_w2 <- left_join(ELSA_w2,ELSA_ds,by="id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
ELSA_ds_w2 <- tibble(id=ELSA_w2$id)
ELSA_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders <- rep(0,length(ELSA_w2$id))
ELSA_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders[which(ELSA_w2$h_joint_disorders==1 | ((ELSA_w2$hedib01==3 | ELSA_w2$hedib02==3 | ELSA_w2$hedib03==3 | ELSA_w2$hedib04==3)))] <- 1
ELSA_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders[which((ELSA_w2$h_joint_disorders!=1 | is.na(ELSA_w2$h_joint_disorders)) & ELSA_w2$hedib01==-9)] <- 997
ELSA_ds_w2$h_joint_disorders[which((ELSA_w2$h_joint_disorders!=1 | is.na(ELSA_w2$h_joint_disorders)) & ELSA_w2$hedib01==-8)] <- 998

# Continuous variable harmonization
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `h_joint_disorders previous == 1 or dhedibar == 1 into 1`
* `h_joint_disorders previous == 0 and dhedibar == 0 into 0`
* `dhedibar == -1 into 996`
* `otherwise into 999`


To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1, h_joint_disorders_age = heagf`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `-9 into 997`
* `-8 into 998`
* `otherwise, h_joint_disorders_age = 999`

```{r harmo w3}
# Categorical variable harmonization

ELSA_ds_w3$h_joint_disorders <- rep(999,length(ELSA_w3$id))
ELSA_ds_w3$h_joint_disorders[which((ELSA_w3$h_joint_disorders!=1 | is.na(ELSA_w3$h_joint_disorders)) & (ELSA_w3$dhedibar==0))] <- 0
ELSA_ds_w3$h_joint_disorders[which(ELSA_w3$h_joint_disorders==1 | (ELSA_w3$dhedibar==1))] <- 1
ELSA_ds_w3$h_joint_disorders[which((ELSA_w3$h_joint_disorders!=1 | is.na(ELSA_w3$h_joint_disorders)) & (ELSA_w3$dhedibar==-1))] <- 996

# Continuous variable harmonization
ELSA_ds_w3$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(ELSA_w3$id))
ELSA_ds_w3$h_joint_disorders_age[which(ELSA_ds_w3$h_joint_disorders==0)] <- 996
ELSA_ds_w3$h_joint_disorders_age[which(ELSA_ds_w3$h_joint_disorders==1)] <- car::recode(ELSA_w3$heagf[which(ELSA_ds_w3$h_joint_disorders==1)],"-1=996;-8=998;-9=997")
ELSA_ds_w3$h_joint_disorders_age[which(ELSA_ds_w3$h_joint_disorders==1 & !is.na(ELSA_w3$h_joint_disorders_age) & !ELSA_w3$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)] <- ELSA_w3$h_joint_disorders_age[which(ELSA_ds_w3$h_joint_disorders==1 & !is.na(ELSA_w3$h_joint_disorders_age) & !ELSA_w3$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)]

# Update of global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- full_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  row.names(newtib) <- newtib$id

  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}
ELSA_ds_prov <- ELSA_ds[,c(1,2)]
ELSA_ds_prov <- assign_merge(ELSA_ds_prov,ELSA_ds_w3,log_vec=ELSA_ds_w3$id,col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `h_joint_disorders previous == 1 or hedibar == 1 into 1`
* `h_joint_disorders previous == 0 and hedibar == 0 into 0`
* `hedibar == -9 into 997`
* `hedibar == -8 into 998`
* `otherwise into 999`


To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1, h_joint_disorders_age = HeAgf`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `-1 into 996`
* `-8 into 998`
* `otherwise, h_joint_disorders_age = 999`

**R script:**

```{r helpfunctions, echo=F}


labelling <- function(l.hds,m.hds,vbl_name,ds_lab = ds_label){
  
  # Labelling of the tibbles with categorical data and creating new tibbles with all missings recodified as NA

  for(name in names(l.hds)) {
    if(vbl_name %in% names(l.hds[[name]])){
      # In the aux_object we copy the old tibble to recodify all missing values as NA.
      aux_object <- l.hds[[name]]
      # Labelling of variables
      label(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]]) <- label(aux_object[[vbl_name]]) <- ds_lab
      # Labelling of categories (for continues variables, only missing values)
      l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]], labels = cat_label)
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[vbl_name]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
      # Labelling of categories (for categorical variables, only non-missing values)
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- labelled(aux_object[[vbl_name]], labels = cat_label[1:(length(cat_label)-9)])
      # Saving the recodified tibble in list m.hds
      m.hds[[name]] <- aux_object
      rm(aux_object)
    }
  }
  return(list(l.hds,m.hds))

}


labelling_c <- function(l.hds,m.hds,vbl_name,ds_lab=ds_label){
  
  # Labelling of the tibbles with continuous data and creating new tibbles with all missings recodified as NA

  for(name in names(l.hds)) {
    if(vbl_name %in% names(l.hds[[name]])){
      # In the aux_object we copy the old tibble to recodify all missing values as NA.
      aux_object <- m.hds[[name]]
      # Labelling of variables
      label(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]]) <- label(aux_object[[vbl_name]]) <- ds_lab
      # Labelling of categories (for continues variables, only missing values)
      l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]], labels = cont_label)
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[vbl_name]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- remove_val_labels(aux_object[[vbl_name]])
      # Saving the recodified tibble in list m.hds
      m.hds[[name]] <- aux_object
      rm(aux_object)
    }
  }
  return(list(l.hds,m.hds))

}


# Creation of summary tables for categorical data

summaries <- function(l.hds,m.hds,lnames,vbl_name){

  # Creation of columns with categories and labels
  t.hds <- frq(l.hds[[1]][vbl_name])[[1]][,c(1,2)] 
  # For each wave/population in l.hds, add the correponding values
  for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
    t.hds[2+i] <- frq(l.hds[[i]][vbl_name])[[1]][,4] 
  }
  # Add sample size for each wave/population
  t.hds[2+length(cat_label),] <- c("n", "sample size", sapply(l.hds,function(wave) length(wave[[1]]))
  )
  # Add wave/population names
  names(t.hds)<-c("val", "label",lnames)
  return(t.hds)
  
}


# Creation of summary tables for continuous data

summaries_c <- function(l.hds,m.hds,lnames,vbl_name){

  # Creation of column with summary table categories
  t.summ <- summary(m.hds[[1]][vbl_name])[1:6]
  # Adding of missing/no-missing values categories
  t.hds <- c(substr(t.summ,1,regexpr(":", t.summ, fixed=T)-1),labels(Continuous_summary(l.hds[[1]][[vbl_name]], missing_values = miss_values_vector)$values_table)[[2]])
  # For each wave/population in l.hds, add the correponding values
  for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
    # First, summary values
    t.summ <- summary(m.hds[[i]][vbl_name])[1:6]
    # Next, missing/no-missing values (the 1 in $values_table[1,] stands for absolute values, while a 2 would stand for percentages)
    t.hds <- cbind(t.hds,c(as.numeric(substr(t.summ,regexpr(":", t.summ, fixed=T)+1,nchar(t.summ))),as.numeric(Continuous_summary(l.hds[[i]][[vbl_name]],missing_values = miss_values_vector)$values_table[1,])))
  }
  # Add sample size for each wave/population
  t.hds <- rbind(t.hds,c("sample size", sapply(l.hds,function(wave) length(wave[[1]]))))
  # Add wave/population names
  dimnames(t.hds)[[2]] <- c(dimnames(summary(m.hds[[1]][vbl_name]))[[2]],lnames)
  return(t.hds)
  
}



# Creation of trajectories table for each population

trajectories <- function(m.hds,vbl_name){
  
  # First wave data
  dbb <- m.hds[[1]][,c("id",vbl_name)]
  # Merge with next waves data
  for(ind in 2:length(m.hds)){
    dbb <- merge(dbb, m.hds[[ind]][,c("id",vbl_name)], by = "id", suffixes = c("", paste0(".",names(m.hds)[ind])), all = T)
  }
  names(dbb) <- c("id", names(m.hds))
  
  # Glue individual data through all waves into trajectories
  v.dbb <- dbb[,2]
  for(ind in 2:length(m.hds)){
    v.dbb <- paste(v.dbb,dbb[,ind+1],sep="")
  }
  # Trajectories and frequencies
  f.dbb <- frq(v.dbb)[[1]][,c(1,2,4)]
  return(f.dbb)
  
}

# Save data tables

savingRD <- function(l.hds,vbl_name){
  
  for(index in seq_along(l.hds)){
    assign(vbl_name,l.hds[[index]])
    save(vbl_name,list = vbl_name, file = paste0(datafolder,names(l.hds)[index],"/",vbl_name,".RData"))
  }
  
}

```

```{r, echo=FALSE}
  # Labelling continuous variable of tibbles
```

Two tables are generated:

```{r summ, echo=F}


# Consider only harmonised waves

}
```
